lines.text: June, you're vacuuming in pearls. You know what that does to me!
You looked as though you just walked out the runway.

Yo, I'm Gilbert. This summer, my parents shipped me off to camp. I caught impetigo. And when I got back, my dad had moved out. Only since then he moved back, but he's still sleepin' in my room and he's sleeping on the couch.
All right. Sit down and shut up! You're gonna learn this stuff if I have to shove it down your throat! And just where do you think you're going... Beaver Cleaver?
Thanks anyway, Judy. But I'd rather go through 3rd grade a hundred times than listen to your ugly voice for one minute!
Wow, Beaver. You really pulled up your grade. You got a "C."
I'm worried. I'm worried. About our. About our. Beaver. Beaver.
Oh no mom. Oh no mom. Oh no-no-no-no-no mom.
